channel.title: Activities
channel.description:
I am currently a sophomore in high-school and finally decided to get interested in some kind of school activity. However, there is a catch. I have no clue what I want to do! I have spent weeks thinking about an activity that I would enjoy and benefit from and came up with a few ideas :
[ul][li]ROTC (the kids in it now get made fun of)[/li] [li]Anime (the kids in it now are classified as dorks)[/li] [li]Football (I am not very coordinated)[/li][/ul]
I know I should do whatever I enjoy no matter what, I just don't want to get made fun of for the rest of my high-school years.
Moving on. It doesn't even necessarily have to be an activity within school, it can be something that takes place at home (or both at home and school) So I began to brainstorm a bit more and came up with a few more activities that would take place outside of school:
[ul][li]MMA or Boxing[/li] [li]Instrument lessons (Such as guitar)[/li] [li]Volunteer work[/li][/ul]
Those are just a few ideas I came up with that I believe I would enjoy the most. I just don't want to be the guy that did nothing all through high-school.
So, the point of this thread is to get suggestions on what I should do. You could even criticize my ideas if you wish. So, with all of this being said, I leave you all with a few questions to answer:
[ul][li]Would you participate in an activity knowing you'd get made fun of?[/li] [li]Have you gone through high-school without participating in some sort of activity?[/li][/ul]
If you're currently attending high-school, do you plan on being active in a particular activity?
Thanks to those who answer and provide advice!

item.title: Activities
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

I wouldn’t care if somebody had a similar name to myself.

Impersonation is one thing, but having similar names is another.

Read full topic

item.title: Activities
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

your highschool years are absolutely nothing and refusing to do something because of a few things kids might make sense is absolutely fucking retarded, do what you want to do and what you enjoy and if you get picked on by the other students you should rejoice in the fact you’ll lose contact with 99.9% of them in a few years

Loveandpower:

You still have not shown any valid proof where having a similar name to somebody else warrants a name change.

it’s common fucking sense you dope, I’m sure you’d get in a pissy if I went around with the name “Loveandpowder” and you got a bunch of people harassing you because I’d be my abrasive self on said name

Loveandpower:

I’m sorry but your logic is almost as stupid as these servers who think you can’t make an account with the name of the server in it. Like “bsscape fred” or whatever.

user “Tutorial” posts, user “Tutorials” posts, the only distinction is an S at the end of the word that isn’t immediately obvious, just like say “Loveandpowder”, the only distinction is a d, it’s still deceptive even if there’s no malicious intent, it’s just like how people with 2, 3 badges often get mistaken, people don’t pay enough attention to the names to notice they’re two different people

he doesn’t HAVE to change his name and there’s NO REQUIREMENT for him to change the name but it’s a bit of a “oh, you might want to change your name as it’s near identical to another use on this website who is also quite active and may lead to some confusion”

Read full topic

item.title: Activities
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

her keys?

Read full topic

item.title: Activities
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

highschool rotc is Jrotc its considerably different but still a fun class. I took 4 years of it simply to take advantage of the P.E. credit. Just like anything else a select group of invidiuals will give the program a bad name. one benifit for being a “rotc nazi” is the fact that you generally get both a P.E. and Science credit.

silab didn’t want her peers to see her silabitems jiggling around in formal p.e.

Read full topic

item.title: Activities
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

Kids stop making fun of ROTC around junior year and realize the value of doing it (you can get full rides for an ROTC scholarship).

Read full topic

item.title: Activities
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

or maybe they both like the name insinuating they like to assist others? There is no harm in having a specific username. I’m sorry but your logic is almost as stupid as these servers who think you can’t make an account with the name of the server in it. Like “bsscape fred” or whatever.

Read full topic

item.title: Activities
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:14, topic:465446”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=570661.msg4133834#msg4133834 date=1351464024]

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=570661.msg4133828#msg4133828 date=1351463671]

Off-Topic: If you plan to stay at this forum, please send a PM to a Admin to request a name change. You name is too similar to another user here (Tutorial).
[/quote]there is no rule that states you can’t have a similar name to somebody else

I think we have established that common sense do affect the rules and management of this site.
[/quote]You still have not shown any valid proof where having a similar name to somebody else warrants a name change.[/quote]
Why can’t you use common sense? The purpose of user names is to disguise the users. By having close to identical names you are creating confusion.

Read full topic

item.title: Activities
item.dc:creator: @Tutorials Tutorials
item.description:
@Tutorials wrote:

I now have my mind set on joining ROTC. Honestly, I have no idea why I didn’t join my freshman year. I have a few friends in the program so I won’t be totally lost, I’m sure they will “show me the ropes”

I know this most likely isn’t categorized as a hobby, but I found out that I enjoy doing housework! There’s nothing I like more than a clean room/work area. That may sound a bit weird but it’s true.

Read full topic

item.title: Activities
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Join rotc and stick it out for 2 years, if you really like it, join the af or any branch for that matter. You’ll automatically be an e-3 when you enlist.

Read full topic

item.title: Activities
item.dc:creator: @Tutorials Tutorials
item.description:
@Tutorials wrote:

@Bowser, Similar names aren’t that big of a hassle, are they? If things get to hectic I am sure we could come up with a solution that works for everyone.

@Silabsoft, At my school it only counts as a P.E credit, which isn’t bad at all considering it’s much more fun than Physical Education itself.

I don’t really care what people think about me, it’s just that I believe things would be much more smoother if I didn’t get picked on. Then again, that’s where true friends come into play.

Read full topic

item.title: Activities
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

I run XC and track as sports (no coordination needed)
Part of model UN
Student sharing - helping the community and stuff
French club

Just do what you like to do. High school classifications aren’t a real thing.

Read full topic

item.title: Activities
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

I don’t know much about high school ROTC or ROTC in general, but I know that if you do ROTC in college, your tuition is covered(granted you have to do like 5 years of service or something like that). I guess high school ROTC just preps you.

Anyhow, I used to be like all you faggots on this site. I sat inside all day and had no interest in participating in high school activities. When I was a freshman, unbeknownst to me, my mother had signed me up for football. I decided to try it and enjoyed it. When the season ended, I got involved with other shit and eventually when I went to apply for colleges I had varsity football/track captain, model UN(conferences for debating world problems), 350 volunteer hours, student government, etc. But I also had a shit ton of fun/friends that I wouldn’t of had.

Basically, network and try things out. Don’t be like one of the faggots on this site who just sit around all day. Pick something and just have fun with. I’ve been working on surfing lately, very fun hobby.

Read full topic

item.title: Activities
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

You shouldn’t care so much about what other people think about you. Do what you enjoy.

Off-Topic: If you plan to stay at this forum, please send a PM to a Admin to request a name change. You name is too similar to another user here (Tutorial).

Read full topic

item.title: Activities
item.dc:creator: @Tutorials Tutorials
item.description:
@Tutorials wrote:

Team_Rocket:

Also, they make fun of people in R.O.T.C?

Yes, and if you are wandering why, I don’t have the slightest clue. However, I have noticed everyone in ROTC are really good friends, almost family-like. I don’t see why they’re in the “geek” category, my school is just full of inconsiderate know-it-alls who are going nowhere in life.

With this being said, I may speak to my guidance counselor about rearranging my schedule. I do have a few friends in the program and they are extremely nice, they are just looked at the wrong way.

Read full topic

item.title: Activities
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:2, topic:465446”]Who cares if people think you’re a “geek” because of what you choose to be affiliated with? Those “geeks” are the future Bosses of America, and the “jocks” are the future dishwashers of America.[/quote]100% agree with this statement

Read full topic
